intro: Aegiphila elongata, commonly known as the longleaf aegiphila, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. Aegiphila elongata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to grow in sandy or limestone soils.
